p: Phylogeographic analyses at regional scales have started to appear during the past few years, revealing a strong effect of palaeogeographic history of current distribution of isopod taxa ( Poulakakis and Sfenthourakis 2008, Kamilari et al. 2014, Lee et al. 2014) but also effects of environmental factors such as sea water temperature for amphibious species ( Eberl et al. 2013) or even evolutionary and dispersal events that may lead to unexpected distribution patterns ( Santamaria et al. 2013). There are still just a few such analyses so far, but we should expect a rapid raise of their publication rates given the modern advances in molecular techniques.
